verbs.description: it [ARGM-TMP: time] to [V: take] [ARG1: your medicine] if clock says so if you are taking any medicines or doling them out to anyone else go ahead and watch the clock just be sure you set it back by an hour before you go to bed tonight then take your medicines as scheduled if you normally take a medicine at 8 a m take it at 8 a m sunday that the advice of nurses who take the beginning and end of daylight - saving time in stride year after year tonight is when the time - warping mandate ends for 1988 remembering to spring forward and fall back will help you set your clocks back tonight if you head for bed at 11 p m change your clocks to read 10 p m but no adjustments should be made in your medicines baptist medical center clock medical - surgical michelle taylor phyllis conard medical surgical director time medicine oklahoma city mercy health center
